Exsolvæ is a data consultancy based in Brussels, Belgium. We are dedicated to fostering a culture of knowledge sharing among data professionals.

Our goal is not only to excel in one discipline, but also to gain a comprehensive understanding of the challenges spread across the four pillars of our expertise:




Data Foundations: Data Engineering to Design, develop, and maintain data architecture and infrastructure, build data pipelines, etc.
BI, Data Analytics & Visualization: Design and implement data visualization solutions that enable to gain insights from the data.
Data Science & Artificial Intelligence: Implement & Develop algorithms in Deep Learning, Machine Learning & Artificial Intelligence.

Expertise:

Engage with clients to understand business challenges and objectives.
Develop strategies to integrate generative AI into business operations.
Identify use cases for generative AI applications such as text generation, image synthesis, chatbots, or content creation.




Technical implementation:

Design, build, and deploy generative AI models using frameworks such as OpenAI, Llamas, Langchain, etc.
Fine-tune pre-trained models to address specific business needs.
Implement AI solutions with a focus on scalability, performance, and security.




Project Management:

Plan and manage AI projects from initiation to completion.
Collaborate with data scientists, engineers, and domain experts to ensure smooth project delivery.
Communicate progress, challenges, and outcomes to stakeholders.




Research and Development:

Stay updated on the latest advancements in generative AI and related fields.
Experiment with new models, tools, and techniques to enhance solution effectiveness.




Training and Support:

Conduct audits, workshops and training sessions for clients and internal teams.
Provide ongoing support and optimization for deployed AI solutions.

Required:

Master’s degree or PhD in Computer Science, Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, or a related field.
Proven experience with generative AI models such as OpenAI, Llamas, Langchain or similar.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python and frameworks like TensorFlow or PyTorch.
Strong understanding of natural language processing (NLP) and computer vision concepts.
Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) for AI deployment.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.

Preferred:

Experience with fine-tuning and customizing AI models.
Knowledge of data engineering, ETL pipelines, and databases.
Familiarity with MLOps tools and best practices.
Strong communication and presentation skills for client-facing interactions.




Advantages of the Position:




Long Term Contract (CDI)
The opportunity to work on a wide range of challenging and diverse projects in industries such as banking, insurance, and pharmaceutical manufacturing.
A collaborative and supportive work environment.
Continuous learning and professional development opportunities.
Attractive salary and benefits package.
The chance to be part of a meaningful project from the start.

Title: Data Scientist (Biochemical Engineering)
Description:
For one of our clients, a pharma company located in the Walloon Brabant, we are looking for an experienced Data Scientist with a background in (bio)chemical engineering, to come on board and join their Drug Substance Innovation Centre. Experience in one of following is a must : Bioprocess modelling - Biochemical engineering - Cell culture engineering - Fermentation technology - Bioreactor engineering.
Hybrid role (min. 2 days/week on site at client's location).

Job Description

The Data Scientist integrates and analyses complex, high dimensional data sets to extract biological knowledge relevant for R&D. This role ensures advanced data analytics and bioinformatics deliverables for R&D projects are at the top of research and industry standards with respect to scientific excellence, quality and timelines.

Responsibilities

Bioinformatics/data analytics activities for R&D;
Data and knowledge integration for hypothesis generation;
Data modelling for innovative assays, high-dimensional readouts and microbial genomics;
Development of tailored systems and analytical models for exploitative analytics of pre-clinical, clinical, and epidemiological data;
Development of analysis pipelines using combinations of heterogeneous, high dimensional datasets and tools;
Advise on study design, readout selection and data formats, data analysis strategies;
Preparation and publication of scientific papers and congress reports.

Requirements

MS in Data and Computer Sciences, Complex Systems, Mathematics and Physics, Biological and Systems Engineering, Bioinformatics, Computational Life Sciences or equivalent with a first experience in the biopharma industry or a PhD in the field of Data Science/(bio)chemical engineering.
Experience in one of the following is a must : Bioprocess modeling - Biochemical engineering - Cell culture engineering - Fermentation technology - Bioreactor engineering
Fluent in English
Experience in using Python and Pandas.
Good understanding of mass balances and metabolic fluxes.
Experience in working with large set of data.
Good programming, data analytics and modelling skills
Good business understanding of the Pharmaceutical industry
Good knowledge of vendors and state-of-the-art solutions for Data Science and Digital Innovation

Hybrid role (min. 2 days/week on site at client's location).

The Data Scientist integrates and analyses complex, high dimensional data sets to extract biological knowledge relevant for R&D. Responsibilities

  • Bioinformatics/data analytics activities for R&D;
  • Data and knowledge integration for hypothesis generation;
  • Data modelling for innovative assays, high-dimensional readouts and microbial genomics;
  • Development of tailored systems and analytical models for exploitative analytics of pre-clinical, clinical, and epidemiological data;
  • Development of analysis pipelines using combinations of heterogeneous, high dimensional datasets and tools;
  • Advise on study design, readout selection and data formats, data analysis strategies;
  • Preparation and publication of scientific papers and congress reports.

Job Description

ARHS Group – part of Accenture is looking for a Senior Data Scientist with a proven track record in developing generative AI applications, for one of its clients in Brussels, a key player in the Financial Industry.

As a Data Scientist, you will need to have expertise in various aspects of Machine Learning. This role offers the opportunity to apply and enhance your skills across multiple domains.




Role & responsibilities

Tackling various business challenges by creating AI applications (virtual assistant & more) aimed at enhancing client experiences, empowering employees with superior tools, and automating and optimizing internal processes.
Utilizing a range of analytical methodologies (generative AI and predictive AI), including large language models (Prompt Engineering, RAG, Fine-tuning), speech-to-text, LLM agentic applications, image generation and interpretation, and classical statistical/machine learning techniques. (While we don't expect you to be an expert in all areas, you should possess strong expertise in core technologies and the ability to learn new methods as required.)
Demonstrating extensive experience in programming with Python and contributing to deploying AI applications in production using a comprehensive stack of tools.
Communicating the fruits of your work directly to the top management.
Accessing one of the richest volumes of varied data in the market and applying your skills to it.
Evolving in an environment where innovation and lean processes are praised, straight-forward communication is encouraged, and peers understand the meaning of team up.
Working with a team of colleagues in an Agile organization who are ready to collaborate and share their experience.




Qualifications

Your profile

Master’s degree in a quantitative discipline, such as statistics, mathematics or engineering. Other academic backgrounds with substantial knowledge of analytics are also encouraged to apply.
Good knowledge in English and Dutch or French
Team player
Business oriented
Quick self-starter, pro-active attitude
Good communication and influencing skills
Good analytical and synthesis skills
Autonomy, commitment and perseverance
Ability to work in a dynamic and multi-cultural environment




Technical skills

At least 3 years of relevant experience in Data Science and Analytics.
Good knowledge of Python, deep learning and pre-trained models
Knowledge of Domino, git, genAI framework (langchain, haystack) would be considered an asset
Knowledge of GenAI Application for Finance would be considered an asset




Additional Information

Don’t hesitate! Join our team

What you’ll get:

An informal hierarchy and work environment:

Our open, flat structure supports a strong focus on communication and collaboration, enabling to respond quickly to market changes and customer requests.




An attractive salary package:

With an attractive salary and benefits package – including advantageous fringe benefits – you’ll be paid for what you love to do.




A strong corporate culture:

You’ll join a dynamic team of smart and ambitious people. From the way we hire to the way we relate to our clients – our values form the foundation of the way we work.




Learning & development opportunities:

We constantly invest in our people and are committed to providing individual development opportunities to help you continue to grow and stay happy and satisfied at work.




Exciting projects:

You’ll take ownership of various projects for both public and private clients: calling for creativity and innovation, at the cutting-edge of technology.




A rock-solid company:

With more than 200 customers, and 15% turnover growth in FY2022, you’ll join a business with a sustainable and growth-oriented plan.




But let’s talk about it face to face!




You have the qualities listed above? Please, send us your CV, which will be processed in full confidentiality.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Organisation




Bluesquare is a fast growing technology company focusing on Global Health. Bluesquare’s goal is to help Global Health resources get where it matters the most. We partner with Global Health Funds, national governments, health service purchasers, and NGOs, to help them make smarter health investments. Bluesquare’s technologies are in use in more than 30 countries and support +60 different clients, including the World Bank, the WHO, the Global Fund to Fight HIV, TB and Malaria, the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation, leading NGOs and consultancies.




For more information about who we are: https://bluesquarehub.com/




Mission and description of the role




We are looking for a Data Scientist with experience in data analysis and visualisation to join our data science team.




Start date: as soon as possible.
Location: Based in Brussels (preferably) but willing to travel to other countries in order to support Bluesquare’s projects. Bluesquare takes into account the safety risks of its employees in the areas concerned.
Team: We are a horizontal company with more than 70 team members in multiple countries. The Data Science team is composed of friendly, supportive and enthusiastic young individuals distributed across Europe and Africa.




We value ownership, autonomy, flexibility, communication and teamwork. We strive for excellence in the solutions we provide for pressing challenges, emphasizing continuous self-improvement and supporting the individual development of our team members. Nevertheless, we firmly prioritize work-life balance, well-being, and recognizing each person as a unique individual for an optimal working environment.




Role and Responsibilities




1. Data Management & Analysis:

In collaboration with the data science team, develop scripts in R or Python for data cleaning, data processing, data integration and data quality screening.
Apply your technical skills in DHIS2 to contribute to improving the management of health data.




2. Automation of procedures

Contribution to the automation of the procedures via different scripting languages (Python, R) in command line or on the Bluesquare data analytics platform OpenHexa in collaboration with the development team.
Provide technical support and documentation on the procedures established.
Write code documentation, user guidelines, articles and other materials that will be useful to communicate with our clients and other partners.




3. Product development:

Contribute to Bluesquare’s products, processes, procedures and tools (product roadmap, user manual, training material, etc.) based on ongoing client needs analysis




4. Data visualisation:

Set up dashboards using different BI and visualisation tools (Tableau, Power BI..) to answer clients’ needs, and develop customised applications for data visualisation.




5. Quality control:

Review and automate scripts to ensure quality control of the released data integration work.




6. Technical writing:

Write code documentation, users guidelines, articles and other materials that will be useful to communicate with our clients and other partners.




7. Capacity building

Provide internal and external trainings for stakeholders in the use of different tools and in-house data solutions
Adapt the curricula of the training sessions to the specific needs of the respective stakeholders
Support other teams in their needs for data analysis based on ongoing needs assessment




8. Additional responsibilities

Contribute to the company visibility/networking on health data systems and Bluesquare visibility (blogs, product descriptions, events)




Our technical stack

You will have to work with the following technologies and software:

Python or R for data processing (data wrangling, forecasting, operational research, geospatial)
The Jupyter data science ecosystem
Data visualisation tools and BI software (Tableau, PowerBI, Superset, Matplotlib, Plotly, Dash,...)
Our own platforms, such as OpenHexa, Iaso and OpenIMIS
Industry-standard tools such as DHIS2 and ODK
Geospatial Software (GDAL, QGIS, Cartographic Rendering Software, etc.)
Data




Profile




Required

Master degree in data management and analysis, statistics, econometrics…
Strong quantitative and analytical skills
Working experience in data analysis (e.g. R or Python), in database management (e.g. SQL)
1-3 years of experience in R/Python programming and with creating scripts to manipulate, clean and analyse data
Good working knowledge of the Jupyter ecosystem
Excellent oral and written communication skills in French and English
Ability to work autonomously
Team player with good interpersonal skills




Preferred

Experience with Docker, Kubernetes or deployment of containerized applications.
Experience with Google Cloud Platform, AWS or Azure.
Experience and familiarity with practices, software and working environment of CICD, DevOps.
Experience with time series forecasting, operational research, supply chain, geosciences
Experience in Global health, Health financing, Disease Surveillance, Geospatial or Monitoring and Evaluation in another sector a plus
Experience with GIS (Geographical Information System) and familiarity with Environmental dataset sources (ex: Google Earth Engine)
Experience with DHIS2 configuration for management of health and with ODK for the creation of forms
Experience with BI tools & with the creation of interactive dashboards (Tableau, Power BI, Superset)
Working experience in Africa, Asia or Latin America




What we offer

Competitive Salary and benefits package
Flexible work hours and extensive remote working options, as we entrust our team members, anticipating a responsible and conscientious utilisation of this trust.
Exciting projects: use data to solve major issues (Health, Education, Waste management, Public Funding Optimization and more)
Impact: manage data platforms impacting the lives of thousands of people
Network: work in collaboration with a wide variety of actors within countries (Ministries, Donors, NGOs, Implementing partners, field staff, etc.)
Hands-on experience: on-site visits and in-depth situation analysis, because we believe that nothing compares to experiencing first-hand the change one is contributing to.
Exciting work environment: join a result-oriented, dynamic & diverse team committed to improve the accessibility and quality of health services, especially for the poorest
